tie-in.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a product such as a record, book, or toy that is related to a new film, TV show etc
tie-in.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a product such as a record, book, or toy that is connected with a new film, TV show etc
tie-in.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Many of the books in the bestseller lists are TV tie-ins.
tie-in.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a way of PROMOTING (=attracting peopleâ€™s attention to) a new film, TV show etc by connecting it with something such as a free gift or well-known product
tie-in.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The movie has no marketing tie-ins with fast-food restaurants.
